title: On the convergence of entropy for K-th extreme
abstract:
Let recall that the term 'k-th extreme' was introduced in a limiting sense.
That is, if $X_{r:n}$ denote the r-th order statistic then for fix k, as
$n\to\infty$, $X_{n-k+1:n}$ is called the k-th extremes or k-th largest order
statistics. In this paper, we study entropy limit theorems for k-th largest
order statistics under linear normalization. We show the necessary and
sufficient conditions which convergence entropy of k-th extreme holds.
